dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1778 IH: To provide that an order by the Secretary of the Interior imposing a moratorium on Federal coal leasing shall not take effect unless a joint resolution of approval is enacted, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Cheney (for herself, Mr. Cramer, Mr. Chaffetz, Mr. McKinley, and Mr. Rothfus) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To provide that an order by the Secretary of the Interior imposing a moratorium on Federal coal leasing shall not take effect unless a joint resolution of approval is enacted, and for other purposes.

section.header: Congressional approval for order by Secretary of the Interior imposing a moratorium on Federal coal leasing
section.text: An order by the Secretary of the Interior imposing a moratorium on Federal coal leasing shall have no force or effect unlessâ€”

paragraph.text: the Secretary submits to Congress the proposed order; and
a joint resolution that approves the order is enacted within 30 legislative days after the proposed order is received by Congress.
